definition: income does not cover expenditure/unable to make ends meet
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
(negative prefix)/not/no
to spread/to lay out/to apply (powder, ointment etc)/sufficient (to cover)/enough

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: With prices rising, many young couples are unable to make ends meet.
sentences.chinese: 由于物价的上涨，很多年轻夫妻是入不敷出。

sentences.english: Tourism are down and many hotels are operating in the red.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业在走下坡路，许多酒店惨淡经营，入不敷出。

sentences.english: Within the industry large agencies gained at the expense of smaller ones.
sentences.chinese: 行业内小旅行社入不敷出，大旅行社枝繁叶茂。

sentences.english: The Greens had economize because Mr. Green's income could hardly cover the expenses.
sentences.chinese: 因为格林先生入不敷出，所以一家人只好省吃简用。

sentences.english: There's more money going out than coming in, I'm worried about the business.
sentences.chinese: 资金入不敷出，我很为生意犯愁。

definition: in debt/in the red/in deficit
lit. build a high desk of debt (idiom); heavily in debt
lit. just sitting and eating, one can deplete even a mountain of wealth (idiom)/fig. to spend one's money without generating any income
deep in debt
hard pressed for money/in financial straits
lit. pulling on the lapels exposes the elbows (idiom)/strapped for cash/unable to make ends meet
lit. eating away next year's food in advance/fig. to dip into the next month's check/live now, pay later
cash flow/financial balance/income and expenditure
surplus/profit
extravagance/extravagant
to spend (money)/expenses
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
to pay (expenses)/expenses/(old) to dismiss (an employee)
to break even/balance between income and expenditure
awkward situation/predicament
to have a cash flow problem
